meanings.definition: A person who reveals or discloses information.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the class to identify the divulgers in the group project.
meanings.sent2: Journalists are often seen as divulgers of important news to the public.
meanings.sent3: The party was full of divulgers sharing their favorite jokes and stories.
meanings.sent4: In the world of espionage, a double agent can be a dangerous divulger of secrets.
meanings.sent5: The whistleblower bravely stood up as a divulger of corporate corruption.

meanings.definition: The act of revealing or disclosing information.
meanings.sent1: The divulgers of classified documents faced legal consequences.
meanings.sent2: Gossip magazines thrive on the divulgers of celebrity scandals.
meanings.sent3: The magician's reveal of the trick left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise was nature's beautiful divulger of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The detective's findings served as a crucial divulger in solving the case.
